    • Method Detail

      • fire

        int fire​(int distance)
  throws WeaponException
        Fire the weapon once, this reduces the current ammo by one bullet
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to the target, for now, if the target is in range, it will be hit
        Returns:
        the damage the weapon deals to the target, the target's armor may mitigate this damage. The damage will be zero if a) the target is out of range (the ammo is still used in this case) OR b) the weapon was out of ammo (ammo cannot be negative)
        Throws:
        WeaponException

      • getNumAttachments

        int getNumAttachments()
        Returns:
        the number of attachments on this Weapon

      • reload

        void reload()
        reload the clip to full capacity. For now, we assume a limitless supply of clips. This may be refactored in the future to take ammo reserves into account.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Displays the Weapon and any attachments.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:

      • getBaseDamage

        int getBaseDamage()
        Returns:

        int getMaxRange()
        Returns:
        the maximum range of the weapon

      • getRateOfFire

        int getRateOfFire()
        Returns:
        the number of times this weapon may fire during a round

      • getMaxAmmo

        int getMaxAmmo()
        Returns:
        the clip size of this weapon

      • getCurrentAmmo

        int getCurrentAmmo()
        Returns:
        the current number of bullets in the clip

      • getShotsLeft

        int getShotsLeft()
        Returns:
        the number of shots left in this round
